intro: Styphelia trichostyla, commonly known as the pink fairywand, is a flowering plant native to the wet heathlands of south-eastern Australia. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its dense, compact growth and small, needle-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, pinkish-white flowers during the winter months, which are highly attractive to pollinators. Styphelia trichostyla is typically found in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded conditions. It is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to form dense ground cover.
